author: LinkMarioSamus

text:
Out of all video games soundtracks, I can't think of any more atmospheric than the soundtracks of Ocarina of Time and Super Metroid.

Speaking of Zelda, Ocarina of Time, The Wind Waker, and Twilight Princess all reminded me of Super Metroid and Metroid Prime far more frequently than Other M did.  ???
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: My favourite game of all time.So atmospheric and feels so...ALIEN
author: drseussisdeaddd

text: Yeah, this particular track feels so darn ominous.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text:
Either this, or place some 2D sequences in the next Metroid game like what Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal, Super Mario Galaxy, and God of War III did for their series.

What if Other M instead started with a cutscene where the "Baby" sucked all but one measly energy point from Samus, and then the opening level would be a rendition of Super Metroid's ending sequence, 2D gameplay and all?

author: GeonXP89

text: @Shkerks Yeah, I mean like I said, Metroid Prime felt like High Space Adventure.  I can see Samus dabling in some of that, it's not like every planet would have to be scary and lonely.  But I just liked Super Metroids feel of desolation and hopeless almost.  Samus was a like a Mom, taking care of a baby metroid like her own daughter.  Reminded me of Ripley in Aliens and that's how I always imagined Samus.  A woman who risked her neck when everyone else was afraid to.  Beats Space "Hunks" any day

author: Christopher Baron

text:
Maridia... The depths of watery secrets, where we can find such resources as the Plasma Beam and the SpringBall, And the Space Jump too... But no matter what we find, there are yet more things we've missed, and we may never find.

Super Metroid was probably the greatest Metroid game of all, in many opinions... Heck, out of all the games, it's got the most mods. I only hope that the future can bring more Metroid games, 3D or 2D, that live up to the standards,

author: Reni

text: @AndyRichterLUE Of course tastes differ!  It's just the level of this argument doesn't seem to be about the mechanical things that MAKE the game great, while at the same time the genres are super friggin' different.  I mean, you say you played Super Metroid and didn't like it, the only logical recourse from that is to ask what 2D games you DO like. If none of the genres are anything like Super Metroid then, there you go. You don't like that kind of game. So what?  Hooray for useful discourse :-/

text:
its funny
by the time you reach this point you would think you are doing good you know, you've past the halfway mark but then being here in this place of darkness and isolation puts you back in the realization that your fighting an army by yourself in an unknown world. i dont know about samus but this is how i would feel if i were her in this place.

author: PRChingon

text: A whole underground world submerged entirely in water, undisturbed since the time of the Chozo. The one part of Super Metroid where you feel almost like you're doing more damage than the Space Pirates, disturbing the delicate balance that has formed here, freezing Chozo history in time. I imagine Samus would feel very sad here, plundering what remains of where she once called Home in order to stop the Pirates.I feel it would be a hard decision for her to make, but a necessary one.
author: Babybahamut

text:

The music fits so perfectly.
